body.p: Mr E G. Evans had me sommoned as witness, and I attended the different courts in 1863 and 4. He carried me and several witnesses to Glasgow last September. Soon after our arrival at town Mr Evans was first on the Jury, myself and other witnesses came home and left him at town. he came home that night and went back to Glasgow the next morning, he went to town and back several days in succession. he came home on fryday night sick with headache and grew worse all night. Saturday morning he was verry sick indeed, kept his bed all morning towards noon he was some better, but not able to ride to Glasgow which is a distance of ten or eleven miles. I know Mr Evans to be a subject of severe spells of sick headache, he is not in a condition to attend to any business whateve when those spells are on him, Myself and the other witnesses held ourselves in readiness, expecting everyday to go to town, but before Mr Evans was able to get to tow town again, the trial was over
